title: Behavioral Economics
description: Human psychology and the rational choice models of economics are joined to better understand human decision-making.  Students will design and execute their own experiments.
restrictions: __HEADER_0__Must be enrolled in one of the following Campuses:
prerequisites: ECON 2100 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of C or ECON 2101 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of C or ECON 2105 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of C or ECON 2106 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of C
